polygon.Polygon

polygon.Polygon Class Reference

The Polygon class represents convex bounding polygons used for collision detection. More...

def getPointAtHeight
 Return the point on the polygon that matches the given Y coordinate and is furthest in the specified direction.
def getPointAtX
 Return the point on the polygon that matches the given X coordinate and is highest or lowest (depending on direction) Just a tweaked version of getPointAtHeight.
def getPointBetweenHeights
 Return the point on the polygon that is furthest in the specified direction and is between the specified heights.

Detailed Description

The Polygon class represents convex bounding polygons used for collision detection.

Member Function Documentation

def polygon.Polygon.draw (   self,
  screen,
  loc,
  camera 
)

Draw the polygon, for debugging purposes only.

Polygons that have been hit turn red for 1 frame.

def polygon.Polygon.getCenter (   self  ) 

Return the center, as the average of all points in the polygon.

def polygon.Polygon.getEjectionDistanceAlongVector (   self,
  vector,
  myLoc,
  alt,
  altLoc 
)

Return the ejection distance of the given polygon out of ourselves along the provided vector.

def polygon.Polygon.getPointBetweenHeights (   self,
  targetRange,
  direction 
)

Return the point on the polygon that is furthest in the specified direction and is between the specified heights.

def polygon.Polygon.projectOntoVector (   self,
  loc,
  vector 
)

Project the polygon onto the given vector.

Return the range (min, max) along the vector formed by that projection.

def polygon.Polygon.runSAT (   self,
  myLoc,
  alt,
  altLoc 
)

Use the Separating Axis Theorem to collide two convex polygons.

See http://www.metanetsoftware.com/technique/tutorialA.html

Member Data Documentation

polygon.Polygon.hit

For debugging purposes, when we collide with another polygon, we set this to True for 1 frame.

polygon.Polygon.lowerRight

Lower-right corner of the polygon's bounding box.

polygon.Polygon.points

Array of points in the polygon.

polygon.Polygon.projectionVectors

A list of all vectors we'll want to project the polygon onto when applying SAT.

Each vector is perpendicular to one of the polygon's edges.

polygon.Polygon.upperLeft

Upper-left corner of the polygon's bounding box.
